hotspots.hotspot: Four candidates received electoral votes in 1860. The names of the parties, including the Northern Democratic, Southern Democratic, and Constitutional Union, show how divided the country was at this time—and how worried many citizens were about the future of the country.
The states won by Abraham Lincoln are shaded orange. He won the two states in the West, and almost all of the states in the North. He did not win any Southern or border state.

You can see that the South is in the minority. You can also see that the South was united behind a candidate—John C. Breckenridge—who supported the continuation of slavery. Look how relatively few electoral votes Southern states had in 1860 compared to the Northern states.
The population differences between the North and the South are obvious here. Breckenridge received only 848,356 votes, whereas Lincoln received 1,865,593.
